doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 14 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 3/27/1987]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 14 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 3/27/1987]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Coverage by Andy Humm of the AIDS crisis demonstration at Trinity Church on March 24, 1987, interview with Larry Kramer2. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund3. Short news stories, appeal for donations3. Discussion of the New York Times coverage of AIDS issue, quality of series and whether it was timely or too-little-too-lateCOMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund4. Continued discussion of New York Times AIDS coverageCOMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine5. Andy Humm on New York City's AIDS education6. News Watch, Senator Pete Wilson introduces a bill to create a Congressional Advisory Panel on AIDS, headed by the National Academy of Sciences 7. Senator Dan Burton of Indiana proposes a bill for mandatory annual HIV testing for all US residents8. New York, Queens co-op agrees to let a gay couple purchase an apartment after the couple went to the city's Commission on Human Rights9. Congressional Hearing on AIDS Education finds that Federal response to AIDS epidemic is "slow, limited, and ultimately impotent"10. Sports Report11. Lavender Health, interview with Dava Weinstein, social worker, and co-chair of "10% of Those We Serve" chemical dependency conference12. George Trahanis announces GCN's 5th anniversary, and a new pledge drive13. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. Episode of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "A Farewell to Tom"2. Closing credits
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 14 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 3/27/1987]: March 1987
